thread.title: Philly sets record high, another 70-degree day possible this week
thread.title_full: Philly sets record high, another 70-degree day possible this week

author: Emily Babay
title: Philly sets record high, another 70-degree day possible this week
text:
Philly sets record high, another 70-degree day possible this week Updated: February 20, 2017 — 7:28 AM EST 2 Share Emily Babay Staff Writer 
Emily Babay is a breaking news producer. She writes about everything from crime to transit problems — and occasionally about good news. More by Emily Babay Arrow icon 
The spring-like weather set a record high in Philadelphia on Sunday, and more temperatures in the 60s and 70s are on tap for the region later this week. 
Sunday's high of 70 degrees at Philadelphia International Airport set a new record for the date, surpassing the previous mark of 68, set in 1948. 
It was the first time the temperature had reached 70 degrees on any February day since 2002, according to National Weather Service records. 
The week starts off with highs in the 50s, but forecasters expect the temperature to reach the mid 60s on Wednesday and then low-to-mid 70s on Friday, before dropping back to the low 60s for Friday and Saturday. 
The highs forecast for Wednesday and Thursday could threaten records. 
In Philadelphia, the record high for Feb. 22 now stands at 68 degrees, set in 1997 and 1974. For Feb. 23, the record for the date is 75, set back in 1874. 
Normal high temperatures in the second half of February are in the mid 40s.
